items.title: Prediction: This Unstoppable Vanguard ETF Will Beat the S&P 500 Again in 2025
items.author: Anthony Di Pizio
items.description: The Vanguard Information Technology ETF (VGT) has consistently outperformed the S&P 500 since its inception in 2004. The author predicts the ETF will continue to outperform in 2025 due to the growing influence of artificial intelligence (AI) on its top holdings, including Apple, Nvidia, and Microsoft.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: The ETF has outperformed the S&P 500 every year since its establishment in 2004, and the author predicts it will continue to do so in 2025 due to the growing influence of AI on its top holdings.
Apple's recent launch of AI-powered features for its devices and its potential work on a humanoid robot could drive further upside for the company and the Vanguard ETF.
Nvidia is the AI hardware king, and its latest Blackwell GPUs are expected to be in high demand from companies like Microsoft and Oracle, which operate AI data centers.
Microsoft is experiencing high demand for its AI data centers, which should continue to drive its cloud revenue and earnings growth, benefiting the Vanguard ETF.

items.title: Nvidia Stock Investors Got Shocking Updates From Microsoft and Google
items.author: Jose Najarro
items.description: The article discusses recent updates impacting semiconductor giant Nvidia, including its upcoming earnings release on February 26. It provides insights on whether investors should buy Nvidia shares before or after the earnings announcement.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: The article discusses Nvidia's upcoming earnings release and its potential impact on the stock, but does not provide a clear recommendation on whether to buy the shares before or after the announcement.

The article mentions that Suzanne Frey, an executive at Alphabet, is a member of The Motley Fool's board of directors, but this information is not directly relevant to the main content of the article.
